result.execSummary:
The defendant Xavier L Perez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: -Sentence credit of 2 days is granted if imposed.

miscConds.notes:
-Costs to be paid as a condition of probation. 
-Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

-Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

-Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling. 
-If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: -Stayed; to be used at agent's discretion. Agent to determine with or without non-working hours.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Xavier L Perez

records.addlTxt: Notice of Bail bond hearing from 05/24/22
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

4:03 PM Defendant Xavier L Perez in court.  Attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen Jr. in court for Xavier L Perez. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. 

Defendant enters a guilty plea to count #1. Court conducts colloquy with the Defendant and finds them guilty of count #1. 

State makes sentencing arguments. 

Defense makes sentencing arguments Defendant makes statements. 

Court orders the following:

COUNT#1:

SENTENCE WITHHELD.
2 days credit against any sentence, if imposed. 

Term of Probation: 18 months
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling;
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

COSTS:  $268.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 60 days, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 22, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Letter from Attorney Jensen requesting an adjournment of the plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for today.
**Reviewed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 7/25/2022 - The adjournment request is granted.**
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 25, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

10:15 AM Defendant Xavier L Perez appeared by Zoom with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.  Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Request for zoom
  **Reviewed by Commissioner Kevin Costello on 07-01-2022. Granted
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Attorney Jeffrey Jensen
Preliminary hearing on July 1, 2022 at 10:15 am.

01:09 PM Defendant Xavier L Perez in court with State Public Defender Law Intern.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
The State have no objection to reinstating bail.
The Defense does not object.
The Court will reinstate bond and quash the warrant.
Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 10:15 am.
EXT CODE 3

10:44 AM Defendant Xavier L Perez not in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court calls the matter for Status of Counsel.
The Court goes over the procedural history of the case.
State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant.
The Court will issue a bench warrant.
EXT CODE 3.
Hearing on May 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:37 AM Defendant Xavier L Perez appeared by Zoom.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Alyssa Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  The defendant states he has not gone to the Public Defender's Office to be evaluated.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  The Court orders the defendant to appear in person at the next date.  Hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on May 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

01:04 PM Defendant Xavier L Perez in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
EXT CODE 3.

10:12 AM Defendant Xavier L Perez not in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant.
The Court will issue a $1,000.00 arrest warrant for the Defendant.
EXT CODE 3.
